body:
The reaction of the Chinese government towards the anonymous "Jasmine Revolution" message circulated around overseas dissident websites and Twitter has alerted investment banks' analysts to cut the rating of Sina's stock value. Some of them anticipated the increase in the risk of the Chinese government tightening the regulation on social media, in particular on "Twitter-like" service such as Sina Weibo. 

Today (February 24 2010), Sina Tech News highlighted the newly released report of Piper Jaffray estimating that the risk of Sina Weibo being shut down within one month was less than 20%. The report also stated optimistically that Sina could ultimately monetize Weibo users at potentially $1-2 dollars per users within the next 3-5 years through sponsored posts and a daily deal service.

However, the issue at stake is probably not on whether or not Sina Weibo would be able to survive but on the users' toleration on its censorship practice. Sina blogger Fan Wenxin points out that the space for free speech relies on government's confidence:

 很难说这种信心是否发生了变化。有关微博的限制正在成为越来越多人的话题。上
周末，香港歌星黄耀明用英文写到他的一个帖子也被删除了。更多用户对此早已司
空见惯。正在普及开来的是其他的控制技术。

 It is difficult to tell if the government's confidence has indeed been eroded. Weibo's restriction has become a hot topic these days. Last weekend, a Hong Kong popstar Wong Yui Ming wrote in English that his microblog had been deleted. Many users are becoming used to such practice. The controlling technique has become more and more popular. 

Apart from deleting post, Sina Weibo also blocks the users' posts from their fans and in the public timeline. The blogger invited comments from other Weibo user:

 上海用户 @夏商 给了我一个听上去合理的答案。他说新浪试图隐蔽
河蟹是不愿意得罪用户。微博“需要我们这样的捣蛋鬼，靠风花雪月是没有吸引力的。
但不控制，微博又无法生存。”

 A user @Xiasheng from Shanghai has given me a reasonable answer. He said the screening away of messages was to avoid direct conflict with the users. Weibo "needs outspoken people. It cannot attract so many people with entertainment news. However, if it fails to control its users, it cannot survive."

Obviously, censorship practice has resulted in a tense relation between the company and its users. When the government tightens it control over online speech, and that Weibo has to strike for its survival under the censorship system, the conflict would be intensified. That's why when the Sina's deputy director Chen Tong (under the username Lao Chen 老沉) popped up in the Sina Tech News' Weibo thread this morning and claimed that the chance of Sina Weibo being shut down within next 20 years would be 0%, many Weibo users reacted strongly against his assertion and criticized the existing self-censorship practice. Here is a selection of comments, starting with Lao Chen's statement:

 老沉 既然说到这个问题了，兄弟我认为：20年内新浪围脖被关闭的可能性是零。(今天 09:11)

 老沉 Now that the issue has emerged. Brothers, in my opinion, the chance of Sina Weibo being shut down within next 20 years is zero. (Today 09:11)

 韩羽 您这边这么严格要求自己，当然不可能被关闭。(今天 09:13)

 韩羽 You have such strict demand upon yourself, of course you won't be shut down. (Today 09:13)

 乱了感觉围脖 只会阉，不会死。(今天 09:13)

 乱了感觉围脖 Sina will only be castrated, it won't die. (Today 09:13)

 还有啥昵称能用 不关，可能出问题，；关了，一定出问题。(今天 09:13)

 还有啥昵称能用 When it is online, it may create some problem; once it is shut down, it will definitely cause problem. (Today 09:13)

 璇的简约生活 是的。删帖关人就是了，为什么要关围脖(今天 09:15)

 璇的简约生活 right, all you have to do is delete post and shut down user's account, you don't have to shut down Weibo (Today 09:15)

 Hawk-yin 老沉盲目乐观了，一旦发微博的不知节制，管制之锤就必定落下，不信赌一局如何？(今天 09:15)

 Hawk-yin Lao Chen is blindly optimistic. Once the users lose control, the hammer will definitely hit on the website. Let's have a bet on this. (Today 09:15)

 五味寿司 一扇门打开了，想关上就不那么容易了。如果微博被关闭，我指的是被关闭，有没有人愿意去散步的？(今天 09:16)

 五味寿司 Once a door is opened, it is very difficult to close it. If Weibo was shut down by force, anyone would like to have a stroll? (Today 09:16)

 中国日报徐扬 能够预测20年后，不是靠人力，而是神力了！！(今天 09:16)

 中国日报徐扬 Only God can predict something that may happen in coming 20 years. (Today 09:16)

 山上没有神仙 新浪在党的领导下是不会被关闭的.(今天 09:17)

 山上没有神仙 Under the leadership of the Party (CCP), Sina will not be shut down. (Today 09:17)

 孙卡拉 被叫停风险还是有的，被公众抛弃的风险也是有的。(今天 09:20)

 孙卡拉 There is a risk in the shutting down of Weibo, and there is also a risk in people abandoning it. (Today 09:20)

 钟启华_cola 只会阉，不会关。外国投行真是扯蛋，对中国缺乏基本常识。就这理解能力，中国网络股在美国怎么跌怎么涨都正常。叫停风险0.2%都不到，别说两成了。与其担心政策风险，担心盈利模式更实在。(今天 09:20)

 钟启华_cola It will only be castrated and will not shut down. Foreign investment banks are talking in bullshit. They don't have any common sense about China. That's why it is normal for the stock value to go up and down. The risk is less than 0.2%, the worry should not fall on the censorship regulation but on profit making model. (Today 09:20)

 丹青兰 被关闭的概率很小，不超过10%，但被监控，被整改的可能性是实实在在存在滴 (今天 09:21)

 丹青兰 The chance of shutting down is very small, less than 10%. But monitoring and manipulation is part of the reality.  (Today 09:21)

 子曰可说不可说 要蛋定。SINA围脖关闭不关闭，不取决于你我，取决于天朝相关管理部门。就算有朝一日，犯了太岁，被迫关闭，也没啥，人总要活下去，以前没有围脖不是一样过得挺好？全世界银民都有FACETIME，天朝没有，不是一样过？一切都是浮云啊，浮云。(今天 09:22)

 子曰可说不可说 Let's stay calm. We are not in a position to decide whether SINA Weibo would be shut down or now. It all depends on the dynasty's control department. Even if it had offended some gods and forced to shut down one day, we still need to carry on our life. We have good life before Weibo. All the people in the world can visit Facebook while we can't, we still survive through. Everything is illusion... illusion... (Today 09:22)

 刘兴亮 既然说到这个问题了，兄弟我认为：2天内新浪围脖被关闭的可能性是零。 (今天 09:24)

 刘兴亮 Now that the issue has emerged. Brothers, in my opinion, the chance of Sina Weibo being shut down within next 2 days is zero.  (Today 09:24)

 胡胡山山 老沉真牛！在中国，企业只能看清未来3-5年的发展道路。您一下就看到20年，厉害！20年后我们还用微博吗？可能3年后我们就不用了(今天 09:26)

 胡胡山山 Lao Chen is so awesome! In China, any corporate can only foresee its prospect in next 3-5 years, you can foresee 20 years! Do we sill use Weibo 20 years later? Probably in 3 year time, we all give up the tool.(Today 09:26)

 iscoder 会不会变成国企 被人民网收购！？(今天 09:37)

 iscoder Is there a chance that Sina become a national corporate and bought up by the people net? (Today 09:37)

 竹子的城市 不会被关，但有可能会在不同时期不断的被暂停使用(今天 09:41)

 竹子的城市 it won't be shut down. But it probably be suspended from time to time. (Today 09:41)

 老新闻民工 天朝的事情很难说 ，说不定下一秒就关了(今天 09:51)

 老新闻民工 It is very difficult to predict what would happen in this heavenly kingdom. There is always a chance that it got shut down in the next second. (Today 09:51)

 砚枫的勃勃 在我看来新浪已经是一个半官方的互联网媒体，再加上他在媒体运营上的经验积累，只要敏感话题控制到位，ZG不会做冒天下之大不韪的浑事！(今天 09:58)

 砚枫的勃勃 In my opinion, Sina is already a semi-official internet media. It has rich experience in operating other media, once its has full control of sensitive subject, the government would not take the risk to agitate people. (Today 09:58)

 白云出岫读书 死是不会死，问题是怎么个活法。(今天 10:25)

 白云出岫读书 Sina won't die. The issue at stake is how it survives. (Today 10:25)

 胜祥之道 关就关吧。思想在我脑子里。这代领导人不让写，就等着大陆跟台湾合并之后再写。酒越陈越香。总不能把我的脑子割下来吧？(今天 11:24)

 胜祥之道 Let it shut down. My thought is in my brain. This generation leaders do not allow us to write, we can wait until the day when China reunifies with Taiwan. Similar to wine, the longer it store, the better it taste. They can't just chop my head off, right? (Today 11:24)

However, the issue at stake is probably not on whether or not Sina Weibo would be able to survive but on the users' toleration on its censorship practice. Sina blogger Fan Wenxin points out that the space for free speech relies on government's confidence:
很难说这种信心是否发生了变化。有关微博的限制正在成为越来越多人的话题。上 周末，香港歌星黄耀明用英文写到他的一个帖子也被删除了。更多用户对此早已司 空见惯。正在普及开来的是其他的控制技术。

Even if it had offended some gods and forced to shut down one day, we still need to carry on our life. We have good life before Weibo. All the people in the world can visit Facebook while we can't, we still survive through. Everything is illusion... illusion... (Today 09:22)

title: China: The Risk of Shutting Up Sina Weibo is Zero!?
